ai.summary: A short, easy 1.7 km hike up Carn Brea BR 29 in the UK. The route follows gentle, well-marked paths, making it suitable for families and casual walkers seeking a quick scenic outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained grassy and gravel paths with occasional paved sections. Gentle elevation and some exposed viewpoints at the summit; expect muddy patches after rain and loose stones on higher sections.
ai.safety_notes: - Check weather forecast before you go; UK conditions can change quickly. - Stay on marked paths and watch your footing, especially when surfaces are wet or slippery. - Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers; bring a light waterproof layer for wind and rain. - Carry water and a small snack; supervise children and pets. - Mobile signal may be limited in remote spots; consider carrying a simple map or offline navigation.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation (or a fully charged phone with GPS)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal (roughly March–October); winter visits are possible but can be windy, damp, and have shorter daylight.

seo.title: Carn Brea BR 29 – Easy 1.7 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the easy 1.7 km Carn Brea BR 29 hike in the UK. A short, scenic route with gentle terrain, practical safety tips, best seasons, and gear recommendations.
